questions.questionText: Deal with made-up people or events.
questions.solutionText: Fiction works are made with the imagination of the writer.
questions.hintText: Has letter T in the middle.

questions.questionText: What goes up but never comes down?
questions.solutionText: No one can stop you from growing old as time progresses.
questions.hintText: It is in your Birth certificate.

questions.questionText: Riddle: A man who was outside in the rain did not get a single hair on his head wet. Why?
questions.solutionText: His head can only get wet but not his hair because he's bald!

questions.questionText: David's parents have three sons: Peter Pan, Peter Pen and what's the name of the third son?
questions.solutionText: The son's are David, Peter Pan and Peter Pen

questions.questionText: Riddle: I follow you all the time and copy your every move, but you can't touch me or catch me. What am I?
questions.solutionText: When light is present, your shadow is visible and it is the only thing that follows you until light disappears.

questions.questionText: Riddle: It belongs to you, but other people use it more than you do. What is it?
questions.solutionText: People call your name everyday more than you, mentioning your name.
questions.hintText: Given by you when you are born.

questions.questionText: Who is the Father of Literature?
questions.solutionText: Geoffrey Chaucer was the first to write what became generally well-known and recognized poems of his time.

questions.questionText: What is the meaning of the phrase ‘Mein Kampf’ in Hitler’s autobiography of the same name?
questions.solutionText: This book describes the process by which Hitler became antisemitic.
questions.hintText: Having a hard time to proceed because I'm...

questions.questionText: Whose death sparked World War I?
questions.solutionText: On June 28, 1914, Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria-Hungary was assassinated. His murder led to World War I.
questions.hintText: He was appointed inspector general of the Austro-Hungarian armed forces.

questions.questionText: Which book was written by Niccolò Machiavelli?
questions.solutionText: In The Prince, Niccolò Machiavelli studied the world of politics by using reason and scientific methods.
questions.hintText: Opposite of a female royalty below the overall throne.
